law.full_text:
PURPOSE. (Added by Ord. No. 171,260, Eff. 8/30/96.)
The purpose of this division is to promote public safety and welfare by reducing the risk of death or injury that may result from the effects of earthquakes on concrete buildings and concrete frame buildings with masonry infills. The Northridge Earthquake caused widespread damage to these buildings, including some collapses. The recent Great Hanshin Earthquake in Kobe, Japan also caused collapse or partial collapse to several hundred of these buildings. These non-ductile concrete buildings are frequently used in Los Angeles for department stores, office buildings, hotels, parking structures and apartment houses. The performance of these structures in an earthquake is essential to the life-safety of their occupants and to significantly reduce the amount of building damage. This division provides voluntary retrofit standards that, when fully followed, will substantially improve the seismic performance of these buildings but will not necessarily prevent all earthquake damage.

unit.catch_line: Presumptive Load Bearing Values Of Soils.
Foundation Walls, Retaining Walls, And Embedded Post And Poles.
General Design Requirements For Lateral Force-Resisting System.
Impact Hazard Glazing In Existing Buildings.
Shafts, Pits And Similar Excavation – Misdemeanor.
Swimming Pools And Other Bodies Of Water – Protective Devices Required.
Openings Other Than Doors Or Glazed Openings.
Conditions Precedent To Issuing A Grading Permit.
Professional Inspection And Certification For Engineered Grading.
Planting And Irrigation Of Cut And Fill Slopes In Hillside Areas.
Areas Subjected To Slides And Unstable Soil.
Testing, Maintenance And Service Of Gas-Detection And Mechanical Ventilation Systems.
Application Of Methane Seepage Regulations To Locations Or Areas Outside The Methane Zone And Methane Buffer Zone Boundaries.
Special Requirements For Fire District Number 1.
Special Requirements For Fire District Number 2.
Special Requirements For The Very High Fire Hazard Severity Zone.
Special Requirements For Fire Buffer Zone.
Basic Maintenance And Repair Of Existing Buildings And Premises.
Requirements Outside Of A Fire District.
Nuisances, Hazardous Buildings And Substandard Residential Buildings.
Change Of Occupancy Group Or Group Division.
Special Conditions Under Which A Permit Will Not Be Issued.
Default In Performance Of Conditions Or Terms Of Permits – Failure To Complete.
Emergency Lighting Standards For Existing Residential Buildings, Group R, Division 1 Occupancies.
Tenant Safety For Apartment Houses, Except For Residential Condominiums.
Design Check – Compatibility Of Roof Diaphragm Stiffness To Unreinforced Masonry Wall Out-Of-Plane Stability.
Special Provisions For Vacant Property Graffiti Removal.
Special Provisions For Vacating, Barricading, Removing Or Demolishing Buildings Or Structures Without Notice.
Payment And Recovery Of Repair And Demolition Funds.
Abatement Of Public Nuisance Conditions Related To A Declared Local Emergency.
Special Provisions For The Repair Of Welded Steel Moment Frame Buildings Located In High Earthquake Damaged Areas.
Procedure For Abatement Of Nuisance; Recovery Of Attorney Fees; Assessment; Notice To Owner; Sale Of Property.
Violations – Penalties For Disregarding Department Orders.
Minimum Requirements For A Limited Structural Analysis.
Determination Of The Stress-Strain Relationship Of Existing Unreinforced Masonry.

law.plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE
PURPOSE. (§ 91.9501)
PURPOSE. (Added by Ord. No. 171,260, Eff. 8/30/96.) The purpose of this division is to promote public safety and welfare by reducing the risk of death or injury that may result from the effects of earthquakes on concrete buildings and concrete frame buildings with masonry infills. The Northridge Earthquake caused widespread damage to these buildings, including some collapses. The recent Great Hanshin Earthquake in Kobe, Japan also caused collapse or partial collapse to several hundred of these buildings. These non-ductile concrete buildings are frequently used in Los Angeles for department stores, office buildings, hotels, parking structures and apartment houses. The performance of these structures in an earthquake is essential to the life-safety of their occupants and to significantly reduce the amount of building damage. This division provides voluntary retrofit standards that, when fully followed, will substantially improve the seismic performance of these buildings but will not necessarily prevent all earthquake damage.
law.html:
PURPOSE. (Added by Ord. No. 171,260, Eff. 8/30/96.)

The purpose of this division is to promote public safety and welfare by reducing the risk of death or injury that may result from the effects of earthquakes on concrete buildings and concrete frame buildings with masonry infills. The Northridge Earthquake caused widespread damage to these buildings, including some collapses.  The recent Great Hanshin Earthquake in Kobe, Japan also caused collapse or partial collapse to several hundred of these buildings.  These non-ductile concrete buildings are frequently used in Los Angeles for department stores, office buildings, hotels, parking structures and apartment houses.  The performance of these structures in an earthquake is essential to the life-safety of their occupants and to significantly reduce the amount of building damage.  This division provides voluntary retrofit standards that, when fully followed, will substantially improve the seismic performance of these buildings but will not necessarily prevent all earthquake damage.
